Articles.Content:
Hello! I am not sure this kind of question fits here, and if it doesn't, please move it mods.

So, IRL, are there any astronaut hierarchy? Like in the military? I am asking this, for I am using that mod that allows you to write notes in-game, and I want to start a Crew Ledger. Obviously, the highest rank belongs to Jeb, followed by Bill and Bob. But that is were I crashed. Commander Jeb, and then what? Lieutenant Bob? Engineer Bill? What comes next?

Even tought that there isn't a hierachy, that astronauts are just Commanders/ Engineers/ Scientists, is this correct?

BONUS QUESTION: If there is a hierarchy, what are your highest ranked Kerbals, perhaps beyond the orange suits?

For the majority of the US space program the rank hierarchy has been the Commander, followed by everyone else.

As for specific jobs and positions, wikipedia has a whole list:

http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Astronaut_ranks_and_positions

So if it's a Mun lander, I could see Commander Jeb, LM Pilot Bill, and Mission Specialist Bob.

The only way to tell them apart at a glance it to look at what seat they're sitting in.

Thank you, I was afraid you'd show me that page, I had seen it before. The problem is that that ranking is mission dependant, meaning that their rank would change every mission. Unless anyone can provide a rank (if there is one at all), I shall invent my own, depending on their time at KSC and skill bars
Thank you! That seems nice! I shall also fiddle with it and add my own touch
